intro: Calyptrogyne ghiesbreghtiana subsp. hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras calyptrogyne, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture and prominent veins. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. This subspecies is adapted to moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats.
